body: I can still get the error with the patch applied.
update qf by using setqflist or caddexpr ðŸ¤” ? i try to reproduce this ..
I haven't figured out how to reproduce this either...

Hmm, this is actually really simple to reproduce with an RPC client. It only needs this test case:
```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua b/test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua
index 489f601d31..2f5961a17d 100644
--- a/test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua
@@ -911,4 +911,12 @@ describe('API: buffer events:', function()
     sendkeys(s)
     assert_match_somewhere(expected_lines, buffer_lines)
   end)
+
+  it('when updating quickfix list', function()
+    command('copen')
+    local b = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+    ok(api.nvim_buf_attach(b, true, {}))
+    command("cexpr ['Xa', 'Xb']")
+    command("caddexpr ['Xc']")
+  end)
 end)
```

rename.to: quickfix: ml_get error when updating quickfix list after RPC nvim_buf_attach

issue.title: fix(quickfix): use correct lnume when appending

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem: ml_get error when updating quickfix buffer with nvim_buf_attach
Solution: use correct lnume parameter in changed_lines for append mode

Fix #34610
